sect1.title: version 3.0 (November 2005)
sect1.para: ProActive is a GRID Java library for parallel, distributed, and concurrent computing, also featuring mobility and security in a uniform framework. With a reduced set of simple primitives, ProActive provides a comprehensive API allowing to simplify the programming of applications that are distributed on Local Area Network (LAN), on cluster of workstations, or on Internet Grids. The library is based on an Active Object pattern that is a uniform way to encapsulate:

listitem.para: a thread as an asynchronous activity,
an actor with its own script,
a mobile and potentially secure entity.

sect1.para: On top of those basic features, ProActive also includes advanced aspects, such as:

listitem.para: a powerful deployment model based on XML descriptors.
File transfer capabilities over the Grid.

sect1.para: ProActive is only made of standard Java classes, and requires no changes to the Java Virtual Machine, no preprocessing or compiler modification; programmers write standard Java code. Based on a simple Meta-Object Protocol, the library is itself extensible, making the system open for adaptations and optimizations. ProActive currently uses the RMI Java standard library as default portable transport layer.

ProActive features several optimizations improving performance. For instance, whenever two active objects are located within the same virtual machine, a direct communication is always achieved, without going through the network stack. This optimization is ensured even when the co-location occurs after a migration of one or both of the active objects.
ProActive and the (de facto) Standards: ProActive has an architecture that allows the library to interoperate with various official or de facto standards:

listitem.para: Globus GT2, GT3 and GT4, Unicore, GLite, ARC (NorduGrid), GSI-SSH
LSF, PBS, Sun Grid Engine, OAR

sect1.para: Please send us comments, suggestions, bug reports at proactive@objectweb.org Your input will be greatly appreciated.
